##  Wolters Kluwer supports clinicians with free evidence-based resources in
UpToDate and a new interactive COVID-19 search intensity map

  

Date

4/7/2020 12:00:00 AM

  *   * __Tweet on Twitter
  * __
  * __
  * [ ![](https://menafn.com/images/shared/img_trnsp.gif) ](javascript:Void\(0\))

(MENAFN - Fenton) Wolters Kluwer, Health is supporting clinicians on the front
lines fighting the COVID-19 pandemic with free evidence-based resources in
UpToDate® and a new interactive COVID-19 search intensity map.  
  
The map helps clinicians and public health agencies track the virus and may
support clinicians in gaining predictive insights on reported cases based on
clinical search activity from 1.9 million clinicians at the point of care.  
  
Since February 1st, UpToDate's clinical COVID-19 topics have been free to
access and viewed over two million times. These topics, and easy-to-read
patient education resources, are updated continuously. In addition, the
UpToDate editorial team has expanded free access to topics in Infectious
Diseases, Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine, providing information related
to diagnosis and management of COVID-19 and its complications.  
  
To support clinicians with patients heading home after hospitalization for
COVID-19, discharge instructions and patient-facing information is now also
available for free. The downloadable PDF includes information about
recommended care at home, follow-up care, medications, what physical activity
will be limited and more.  
  
To help epidemiologists and public health agencies turn the tide on the
coronavirus pandemic, Wolters Kluwer has developed a global interactive bubble
map that highlights areas of high clinical search intensity in UpToDate, which
may support clinicians in gaining helpful insight to anticipate regional
increases of reported COVID-19 cases.  
  
Cross-disciplinary teams at Wolters Kluwer developed the interactive map by
analyzing how often specific questions related to COVID-19 are searched by
doctors, nurses and other clinicians globally. This leverages global search
activity in UpToDate, a trusted resource used by more than 1.9 million
clinicians for clinical decision support in direct patient care.  
  
Data scientists calculated and displayed what is called 'search intensity' and
also factored into this bubble map cases of COVID-19 reported by Johns Hopkins
University. In previous studies (looking at MERS and influenza),1,2 an
increase in search intensity correlated with documented outbreaks.  
  
The map illustrates how search intensity increases over time in regions around
the world and where it is diminishing.  
  
'For almost 30 years, UpToDate has supported clinicians around the world and
promoted the best patient care.' said Alaa Darwish, Country Manager Middle
East, Turkey and Africa - Clinical Effectiveness at Wolters Kluwer, Health.
'We want to support healthcare providers across the region in any way we can
in the fight against COVID-19.'  
  
View the live map now: https://covid19map.uptodate.com?utm_source=press-
release&utm;_medium=website&utm;_campaign=interactive-map-pr  
  
Read more  
Wolters Kluwer will continue to make resources available for clinicians
battling COVID-19 around the world. For more, please bookmark and visit the
Wolters Kluwer COVID-19 (Coronavirus) Resources & Tools page at
http://healthclarity.wolterskluwer.com/coronavirus-
resources.html?utm_source=press-
release&utm;_medium=website&utm;_campaign=interactive-map-pr  
  
  
1.Thorner AR, Cao B, Jiang T, Warner AJ, Bonis PA. Correlation between
UpToDate searches and reported cases of Middle East respiratory syndrome
during outbreaks in Saudi Arabia. Open Forum Infectious Diseases 2016; 3(1):
ofw043.  
2.Santillana M, Nsoesie EO, Mekaru SR, Scales D, Brownstein JS. Using
clinicians' search query data to monitor influenza epidemics. Clinical
Infectious Diseases 2014; 59(10): 1446.

#  **Former Chief of Staff from U.S. Department of Veteran Affairs Joins
Medallia**

_Will Lead Public Sector and Healthcare Efforts_

March 11, 2020 08:00 AM Eastern Daylight Time

SAN FRANCISCO--([BUSINESS WIRE](https://www.businesswire.com/))--[Medallia,
Inc.](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.medallia.com&esheet=52187332&newsitemid=20200311005231&lan=en-
US&anchor=Medallia%2C+Inc.&index=1&md5=f2128d457d4f0d04a3c5e42507665689)
(NYSE: MDLA), the global leader in experience management, today announced that
Lee Becker, former chief of staff for the Veterans Experience Office of the
U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) has joined Medallia as a solutions
principal for the company’s [public sector
business](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.medallia.com%2Fxchange%2Fvoice-
of-the-public-package%2F&esheet=52187332&newsitemid=20200311005231&lan=en-
US&anchor=public+sector+business&index=2&md5=1a79937e58fa5579de788865a306a653).

> “I saw first hand the positive impact customer experience has on Veterans,
> families, caregivers, and survivors. I am ecstatic to be taking the
> knowledge and best practices I gained during my tenure at the VA and helping
> to support the [President’s Management
> Agenda](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Furl%3Fq%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.performance.gov%2FCAP%2Fcx%2F%26sa%3DD%26ust%3D1583879400463000%26usg%3DAFQjCNFrlnYupoe5WxIeFbvDeeO5-gGDJw&esheet=52187332&newsitemid=20200311005231&lan=en-
> US&anchor=President%26%238217%3Bs+Management+Agenda&index=3&md5=8385a1c417391723f5d828905e7f63e6)
> goals to improve the lives of citizens. Medallia has a unique and powerful
> platform that can proactively assist the private and public sector in
> delivering the very best experiences to its customers,” said Lee Becker for
> Medallia.

Mr. Becker brings expertise in increasing trust and delivering solutions to
help healthcare and government agencies better understand the moments that
matter and how to improve them, to Medallia. Over his time at the VA, Lee
enabled a team to deliver a 19 point increase in overall VA trust, helping to
save the lives of Veterans in crisis, and a 6% increase in the VA’s patient
experience. He will leverage his experience and Medallia’s real-time insights
capabilities to help healthcare systems and federal, state, and local agencies
improve the patient and citizen experience.

“Lee’s award-winning work at the VA has improved the wellbeing and saved the
lives of our nation’s heroes. As a solutions principal, he will leverage his
expertise to help other organizations achieve success in transforming citizen
and customer experience using Medallia’s leading SaaS platform,” said
Elizabeth Carducci, senior vice president of solutions principals at Medallia.

Follow us on
[Twitter](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2FMedallia&esheet=52187332&newsitemid=20200311005231&lan=en-
US&anchor=Twitter&index=4&md5=0f59f871d935aab898cf5c55f935bea3),
[Facebook](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2FMedalliaInc%2F&esheet=52187332&newsitemid=20200311005231&lan=en-
US&anchor=Facebook&index=5&md5=edb2466b004466dc7133aca1339070dc) and
[Instagram](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fmedallia_inc%2F%3Fhl%3Den&esheet=52187332&newsitemid=20200311005231&lan=en-
US&anchor=Instagram&index=6&md5=354854d679b25c6dce03757ef888fe2f)

**About Medallia**

Medallia (NYSE: MDLA) is the pioneer and market leader in Experience
Management. Medallia’s award-winning SaaS platform, the Medallia Experience
Cloud, leads the market in the understanding and management of experience for
customers, employees and citizens. Medallia captures experience signals
created on daily journeys in person, digital and IoT interactions and applies
proprietary AI technology to reveal personalized and predictive insights that
can drive action with tremendous business results. Using Medallia Experience
Cloud, customers can reduce churn, turn detractors into promoters and buyers,
and create in-the-moment cross-sell and up-sell opportunities, providing clear
and potent returns on investment.
